revised_title: Advances in Calculating Bond Lengths in Conjugated Molecules
tldr: This article discusses the current methods for calculating bond lengths in conjugated molecules and explores the concept of fractional bond order. It compares different definitions of bond order and their corresponding order-length curves, highlighting the limitations and advantages of each method. The author also presents a strong correlation between experimentally determined bond lengths and theoretically calculated bond orders, validating the concept of fractional bond order and its application in predicting bond lengths.
